byline.contributor: Liz Robbins and Samantha Schmidt contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By FERNANDA SANTOS and JENNIFER MEDINA

abstract: Protests break out across United States after Supreme Court decision leaving undocumented parents vulnerable to deportation; immigrants are divided over whether open activism or avoiding attention is best strategy; issue's importance is heightened amid anti-immigrant rhetoric of presumptive Republican presidential nominee Donald J Trump.

headline.print_headline: Undocumented Immigrants Live in Fear After Court Ruling
headline.main: Speak Up or Stay Hidden? Undocumented Immigrants Cautious After Court Ruling

snippet: Many immigrants now wonder how aggressively they can push for change, or even just live their lives, when one wrong move could mean being deported.
lead_paragraph: Many immigrants now wonder how aggressively they can push for change, or even just live their lives, when one wrong move could mean being deported.
